Number of days

Number of seconds

1 hour = 3600 seconds

1 minute = 60 seconds

Adds them up to calculate the total time in seconds.

Outputs the total seconds.

description:
Chef Circle | Gamified, AI-Powered Cooking Platform | Food Lovers‚Äô Creative Hub

Chef Circle is an innovative platform designed for food enthusiasts at every skill level‚Äîfrom kitchen beginners to aspiring chefs. Combining gamification and advanced AI technology, Chef Circle creates an engaging, collaborative environment where users can share recipes, participate in cooking challenges, and grow their culinary skills in a fun, social way.

Key Features:

Gamification: Earn XP, level up, and unlock badges through recipe sharing, challenges, and community engagement.

AI-Powered Tools: Smart meal planning, ingredient substitution suggestions, and AI-assisted recipe creation to simplify cooking and inspire creativity.

Interactive Courses: Step-by-step multimedia lessons tailored for all cooking levels, with progress tracking and XP rewards.

Community & Collaboration: Chat rooms, live events, and a strong social network where food lovers connect, learn, and share.

Recipe Sharing & Challenges: Upload, edit, and remix recipes, compete in themed cooking contests, and showcase your culinary portfolio.

Founded and Built by Advithya Bhardwaj, 16 years old passionate about food and technology, ChefsCircle is more than just an app‚Äîit‚Äôs a growing community where creativity, skill, and technology come together to empower the next generation of chefs.

title: PassKit
description:
PassKit is a modern, macOS-native GUI designed to simplify the process of bypassing Setup.app on legacy iOS devices. Built on top of LukeZGD‚Äôs open-source Legacy iOS Kit, PassKit brings a clean, user-friendly interface to a traditionally command-line-based workflow ‚Äî no Terminal required. Just connect your device, click, and go.

Whether you're restoring an old iPhone, experimenting, or simply want to bring a device back to life, PassKit streamlines the process with features like real-time logging, automatic device detection, and full Dark Mode support. Everything is fully integrated ‚Äî no external configuration necessary.

PassKit requires macOS 26.0 or later, Python 3, and libimobiledevice. It works best with devices running iOS 9 to 12. For advanced use cases, a jailbroken or rooted device is recommended.

An official installer, portable version, and Homebrew tap are in development. Released under the MIT license, PassKit welcomes contributions, suggestions, and community involvement.

Made with care for tinkerers, enthusiasts, and tech minimalists.

title: Tortoiseshell ‚Äî Tabbycat/Calico Tab Tools
description:
Ever heard of Tabbycat? (https://github.com/TabbycatDebate). In the world of competitive debating (particularly British Parliamentary or World Schools format), Tabbycat is the gold-standard, globally-used software platform for running and recording the results of tournaments.

Tabbycat has some great integrated statistical features (like displaying the "balance"/one-sidedness of topics based on debate results), but also supports an API so geeks like me can manipulate and aggregate data to our hearts content ‚Äî and that's exactly what I've done with Tortoiseshell.

Just like Tabbycat hosts debate tabs, Tortoiseshell (a different coat pattern :) is a shell for users to interact with raw tab data from the Tabbycat API. Built with Python and Flask, Tortoiseshell allows debaters to unlock deeper statistical insights from tournaments (like motion balance specifically for rooms above a certain skill percentile, judge score averages, and side/position frequency among breaking teams) and track their performance across tournaments, analyzing long-term patterns and trends.

title: Shake Alert
description:
Real-Time Earthquake Detector & Disaster Response Demo
This repository is a demo web application for real-time earthquake detection and disaster response, leveraging the power of crowdsourced sensor data, mapping, and robust communication features. The application is built primarily with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, and uses Firebase for backend services.

Key Features
Earthquake Detection via Phone Sensors:
Utilizes the phone's accelerometer to detect significant shaking. When multiple nearby devices register similar patterns, an earthquake is confirmed and real-time alerts are sent out.

Crowd Confirmation:
Earthquake events are validated using data from surrounding users‚Äô devices, ensuring high accuracy and reducing false alarms.

Disaster Heatmap (Snapchat-style):
Users can post photos and videos from affected areas. These are aggregated and displayed as a heatmap on Google Maps, visually representing disaster intensity and scope.

Interactive Map with Profile Markers:

When zoomed in, user locations are shown as their profile pictures on the map.
Hovering or clicking a marker opens a popup with user details (name, status, contact info, etc.).
Marker clustering for low zoom levels, expanding into individual profiles as you zoom closer.
Real-Time Location & Alerts:
The app continuously shares and updates user locations for efficient disaster response and coordination.

Offline Chat & Satellite Connectivity:
Supports offline messaging and satellite communication features (targeted for Android 15), ensuring connectivity even during network outages.

User Authentication:
Secure login, signup, and session management for all users.

Firebase Integration:
Handles authentication, real-time data updates, and backend logic.

title: Comfort Mode Framework Toolkit
description:
‚ÄúBeyond Compliance: A User-Autonomy Framework for Inclusive and Customizable Web Accessibility‚Äù
Based on: https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2506.10324
This project brings the ideas from this research to life by building a practical toolkit to help developers create more inclusive websites ‚Äî not just compliant, but comfortable.

It focuses on actionable, plug-and-play tools (like a customizable "Comfort Mode" toggle) that give users real control over their experience ‚Äî think contrast adjustments, font changes, reduced motion, and more ‚Äî all while respecting aesthetics and brand identity.

The goal? Make it easy for devs to design with care, adapt to diverse needs, and center user autonomy from the start.

It helps answer:
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúWhat should I pack today?‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúWhat did I leave unfinished yesterday?‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúHow can I waste less food next week?‚Äù

The app learns from your habits and makes small changes over time ‚Äî promoting nutrition, variety, and zero-waste habits, one tiffin at a time!

title: TemporaryGPT
description:
A small tool to make life on ChatGPT more easier. Most of us only use ChatGPT for small quick questions. These are chats we'll never look back to and hence it would be best if ChatGPT never stored them in the first place.

This is why, using the TemporaryGPT userscript, you will be automatically redirected to the temporary chat of ChatGPT.  Just a little add-on but it will also close the sidebar so you that you can focus on your chat.

A great thing about this is that it will only work on the intial load, meaning it won't block you from going to a new chat or other parts of the website.

Decimal to Binary Conversion
Users can input a decimal (base-10) number, and the program converts it to its equivalent binary representation.

title: Visionary AI Glasses Software For Visually Impaired Students in Education
description: This software is designed for a pair of smart glasses, using machine learning and a CRNN model to convert text in the user's field of view into audio in real time. It provides a hands-free, accessible reading experience for visually impaired students. While I‚Äôve completed the core software, capable of capturing images, processing text, and generating speech, the hardware integration is part of my future plans. The final device will include a Raspberry Pi, camera module, and other compact components, forming lightweight, wearable glasses. Unlike traditional solutions like braille books or e-pens, this system offers a portable and easy to use solution for students in low-resource environments to access educational content.

title: EcoPantry
description: EcoPantry is a Maven based JavaFX application that aims to help solve the global climate crisis, billions of dollars in food waste, and money waste. EcoPantry allows users to login and scan receipts (w/ Google's Tesseract OCR), as well as auto-add groceries to let them keep track of what they have online. The application‚Äôs color-coded expiry date tracking prevents users from throwing food away too early and too late, and the implementation of APIs (TheMealDB) allows EcoPantry to recommend recipes for close-to-expiring foods. Statistics are also automatically generated to notify users on their food wastage, savings, and financial waste/savings. A points system is also built-in, rewarding users for good choices. A SQLite database is used to manage login, groceries, and almost everything pertaining to specific users.

title: Locnix AI
description:
Locnix.ai is an AI-powered tool that helps students turn any study material into flashcards instantly. You just paste your class notes, a paragraph, or a topic, and it automatically creates question-answer flashcards that make revision fast and effective. It‚Äôs perfect for students preparing for exams, Olympiads, or competitive tests.

How I made it:
I built Locnix.ai using:

Cursor for coding with AI assistance,

Bolt for quickly setting up the website backend and frontend,

Lovable.ai to help shape the idea, UI flow, and branding.

I used no-code and low-code tools in combination with my logic to turn a simple idea into a working site. The flashcards are generated using an AI model that understands user input and breaks it into useful Q&A pairs. The site is clean, fast, and works on any device.

What makes it special:

It's made by a student, for students ‚Äî simple, fast, and distraction-free.

You don‚Äôt need to sign up or download anything ‚Äî just paste and go.

It uses AI to actually understand the content and generate useful flashcards, not just summaries.

Built transparently using modern tools like Cursor, Bolt, and Lovable, proving that anyone with a vision can build powerful tools today.

WPM and Accuracy Tracking: Get real-time feedback on your Words Per Minute (WPM) and accuracy percentage at the end of each round.
Modern & Clean UI: A beautifully designed interface with a sleek dark theme and vibrant yellow accents that is easy on the eyes.
Responsive Design: Practice your typing on any device, whether it's a desktop, tablet, or mobile phone.
Instant Feedback: Incorrect letters are immediately highlighted, helping you to recognize and correct mistakes as you type.
Focus Mode: The typing area lights up when active, helping you stay focused during the game.

title: FarmAI - An AI based project to help farmers.
description:
Inspiration
Growing up, I saw how many farmers in rural areas struggled with unpredictable weather, poor crop yields, and limited access to expert advice. This deeply inspired me to create a solution that could empower them with the right information at the right time. I‚Äôve always been passionate about technology and artificial intelligence, and I wanted to apply these tools to solve real-world problems.

The idea of combining AI with agriculture came from observing how data-driven systems are transforming industries, while agriculture still faces huge gaps in access to information. I realized that even small changes‚Äîlike recommending the right crop or identifying pests early‚Äîcould have a big impact on a farmer‚Äôs income and food security. That‚Äôs what motivated me to build this AI-based platform: to support farmers, reduce resource waste, and make agriculture smarter and more sustainable.

What it does
This project is an AI-powered farming assistant that helps farmers make smart, data-driven decisions to increase productivity and reduce waste. Based on inputs like weather, soil type, pH, NPKC levels, and farm size, it performs the following key functions:

Crop Recommendation: Suggests the most suitable crop using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN), based on soil and environmental conditions.

Irrigation & Water Prediction: Uses ANN to recommend the best irrigation method and estimate the right amount of water needed.

Yield Prediction: Predicts potential crop yield using ANN, helping farmers plan better.

Fertilizer Recommendation: Uses a Random Forest model to recommend the correct type of fertilizer based on nutrient levels and crop type.

Fertilizer & Pesticide Quantity Estimation: An ANN model calculates the exact amount of fertilizer and pesticide needed, avoiding overuse and reducing costs.

The platform uses a Next.js frontend for user interaction and a FastAPI backend to process the inputs and return AI-generated recommendations. It aims to make farming more precise, efficient, and accessible for all.

How we built it
We built this project using a modern and scalable tech stack, combining machine learning models with a full-stack web application.

Frontend: We used Next.js to build a responsive and interactive frontend that allows farmers to input data such as soil type, pH, NPKC levels, weather details, and farm size. The interface is designed to be user-friendly and mobile-compatible for easy access.

Backend: The backend is powered by FastAPI, a fast and efficient Python web framework. It handles incoming requests, processes data, communicates with the machine learning models, and returns predictions to the frontend.

Machine Learning Models:

Crop Recommendation: Built using an Artificial Neural Network (ANN) to analyze environmental and soil parameters.

Irrigation and Water Requirement: An ANN predicts the most suitable irrigation method and how much water the crop will need.

Yield Prediction: Another ANN model estimates the potential yield based on input factors.

Fertilizer Recommendation: A Random Forest classifier determines the best fertilizer based on soil nutrients and crop type.

Fertilizer & Pesticide Quantity: An ANN model calculates precise quantities required to avoid overuse.

Training & Data: We trained our models using agricultural datasets containing soil, weather, and crop data. Each model was evaluated and fine-tuned to improve accuracy and generalization.

All components are integrated seamlessly, ensuring that users get real-time, reliable insights through a web-based interface.

Challenges we ran into
Building this AI-powered farming assistant as a solo developer was a challenging yet rewarding experience. I encountered several obstacles throughout the development process:

Data Collection & Cleaning: Finding accurate, real-world agricultural datasets was difficult. I had to combine multiple sources and spend time cleaning, organizing, and preprocessing the data to make it suitable for model training.

Choosing the Right Models: Selecting the best algorithms for different tasks required experimentation. I tried various models before finalizing ANN for crop prediction, water estimation, and yield prediction, and Random Forest for fertilizer recommendations. Fine-tuning them to get good accuracy without overfitting took time.

Feature Selection: Understanding which input features (like pH, NPKC, farm size, etc.) were most relevant for each prediction task was a major challenge. I had to study agricultural practices and test combinations to get meaningful outputs.

Frontend-Backend Integration: Connecting the Next.js frontend with the FastAPI backend was tricky. I ran into CORS issues and had to carefully manage API routing and request handling to make the data flow smooth and responsive.

Balancing Accuracy & Simplicity: While aiming for high model accuracy, I also had to ensure the system remained simple enough for farmers to use. It was tough to design a system that‚Äôs both powerful and practical.

Designing a User-Friendly Interface: I had to make the UI intuitive, clean, and usable even on mobile devices, keeping in mind that many users may not be tech-savvy. Creating a smooth user experience took multiple design iterations.

Working alone pushed me to learn, adapt, and solve problems independently, and this experience helped me grow both technically and personally.

Accomplishments that we're proud of
Built a Complete AI Solution from Scratch: I successfully designed and developed an end-to-end AI system that predicts crops, irrigation needs, fertilizer types, and yield using real agricultural data.

Integrated Full Stack Technologies: I built a fully functional frontend using Next.js and connected it seamlessly to a FastAPI backend, managing both UI design and backend logic on my own.

Trained Multiple ML Models: I implemented and trained multiple machine learning models (ANN and Random Forest) tailored for specific agricultural predictions, achieving good accuracy and real-world usability.

Designed a Clean, Usable Interface: I created a user-friendly web interface that‚Äôs responsive and accessible, ensuring ease of use even for farmers with limited technical knowledge.

Learned & Applied Real-World Problem Solving: I tackled real-world issues like data inconsistency, model selection, and feature engineering, and found effective solutions through research and persistence.

Stayed Consistent & Self-Motivated: As a solo developer, I‚Äôm proud that I stayed committed, organized, and motivated through each phase‚Äîfrom planning and coding to testing and deployment.

What we learned
Throughout this project, I gained valuable experience and technical skills across multiple areas:

Applied Machine Learning in Agriculture: I learned how to train and evaluate ML models like ANN and Random Forest for real-world agricultural use cases, including crop prediction, yield estimation, and fertilizer recommendations.

Full-Stack Development: I improved my skills in both frontend and backend development using Next.js and FastAPI, learning how to integrate APIs, manage state, and build responsive, user-friendly interfaces.

Data Handling & Preprocessing: I learned the importance of clean, relevant data. I developed skills in data cleaning, normalization, and feature engineering to prepare datasets for model training.

Model Optimization & Evaluation: I gained hands-on experience in tuning hyperparameters, avoiding overfitting, and improving model accuracy and generalization.

Problem-Solving & Debugging: I faced many technical challenges, especially in backend integration and model deployment, which taught me to troubleshoot issues methodically and stay persistent.

User-Centric Thinking: Designing an interface with farmers in mind taught me the value of simplicity and accessibility in tech solutions.

This project gave me the confidence to build practical AI tools and showed me how technology can make a real difference in critical fields like agriculture.

What's next for FarmAI
FarmAI is already live and deployed at farmai-nine.vercel.app(since its backend is hosted on Render's free tier its backend works slow sometimes), providing farmers with AI-powered recommendations. But this is just the beginning. Here's what's next for FarmAI:

Frontend Enhancements & New Features: Continue improving the user interface for a better user experience, adding new functionalities, and optimizing the app for faster loading times.

Multilingual Support: Add support for regional languages to make the platform more accessible to farmers from different areas, especially those in rural regions.

Integration with Real-Time APIs: Incorporate real-time weather and soil data APIs to provide more accurate predictions based on live environmental conditions.

Database Expansion: Add more crop varieties, soil types, and fertilizer profiles to ensure the system caters to a broader set of geographical areas and farming needs.

title: Web React Video Audio Downloader
description:
A full-stack media downloader built with React (frontend) and Express.js (backend), integrated with yt-dlp and FFmpeg. This tool allows users to input a video/audio URL on the web interface and fetch all available download options, including formats, codecs, and quality settings.

Once a user selects a desired format, the download process begins on the server, allowing them to safely leave and return later without interrupting the download. Upon completion, a direct download link is generated and shown in the downloads list, enabling seamless transfer to the user's device.

Perfect for anyone looking to build or use a self-hosted solution for managing media downloads via a clean and efficient web interface.

title: Pass-the-project: Slack-based community game
description:
Pass-the-project is a collaborative coding project taking place in the Hack Club slack. I'm working on a bot that will help facilitate the game. The rules are as follows:
    1. People vote on a project and tools
    2. The project is hosted on a private GitHub repository
    3. One person has up to a week to work on the project
    4. Once the person pushes to the repo, they lose edit access but can still view, create issues, etc
    5. That person then passes the project onto another person who will be added to the repo
    Repeat until the project is shipped!

- Community features: users can share their routes and take pictures along the way.

The front end is being built using Next.js and Capacitor with Ionic and Konsta UI. The map will be built using the MapTiler SDK. The tiles come from OpenMapTiles.
The API backend will be written in Go using Fiber as the server.

I use AI to search for and fix bugs and errors.

title: Native Notes
description:
A note taking app that has native apps across major platforms (Android, MacOS, and web for the time being) with syncing being the primary feature. 
One thing I've noticed in the note taking apps market is that, if it has multi platform syncing feature then it doesn't feel native to the OS itself or It doesn't have some specific features that I need (for example, locking specific notes with a pin).
For this reason, I am going to make a light-weight app that feels snappy, fully integrated into the platform it's running on (using their native UI frameworks instead of cross platform ones like flutter), and a web UI to quickly access your notes on a different device (Public Library computers for example).

title: 2048: Endgame
description:
*2048: Endgame* - Bash Your Way Through Multipliers, Dividers, and the Forbidden 1!

*Features*
- Play 2048 in your terminal with simple keyboard commands.
- New multiplier feature. (tiles can go x2 or /2)
- This version adds the forbidden 1 (you get it by passing 2 through a "/2" multiplier).
- 3 Difficulty levels:
  - Easy: 6x6 grid, classic normal game.
  - Hard: 4x4 grid, 20% chance each for a "x2" or "/2".
  - Expert: 4x4 grid, 60% chance for "/2", 20% chance for "x2".
- Keeps track of your score.
- No dependencies-just Bash!
- Easy to use and lightweight (literally no dependencies).

Note: Multipliers don't change their position on the board, they just modify the tile going through them.

title: Filter
description:
Perhaps the simplest way to represent an image is with a grid of pixels (i.e., dots), each of which can be of a different color. For black-and-white images, we thus need 1 bit per pixel, as 0 could represent black and 1 could represent white, as in the below.

a simple bitmap

In this sense, then, is an image just a bitmap (i.e., a map of bits). For more colorful images, you simply need more bits per pixel. A file format (like BMP, JPEG, or PNG) that supports ‚Äú24-bit color‚Äù uses 24 bits per pixel. (BMP actually supports 1-, 4-, 8-, 16-, 24-, and 32-bit color.)

A 24-bit BMP uses 8 bits to signify the amount of red in a pixel‚Äôs color, 8 bits to signify the amount of green in a pixel‚Äôs color, and 8 bits to signify the amount of blue in a pixel‚Äôs color. If you‚Äôve ever heard of RGB color, well, there you have it: red, green, blue.

If the R, G, and B values of some pixel in a BMP are, say, 0xff, 0x00, and 0x00 in hexadecimal, that pixel is purely red, as 0xff (otherwise known as 255 in decimal) implies ‚Äúa lot of red,‚Äù while 0x00 and 0x00 imply ‚Äúno green‚Äù and ‚Äúno blue,‚Äù respectively. In this problem, you‚Äôll manipulate these R, G, and B values of individual pixels, ultimately creating your very own image filters.

In a file called helpers.c in a folder called filter-less, write a program to apply filters to BMPs.

This is a problem from CS50x, Problem Set 4.

title: LockArithm
description:
LockArithm is a next-gen password manager trying to improve security by not storing passwords (as usually one in this industry), bt rather generating them on demand. We're seeking to improve both password and password manager security at the same time using algorithms to calculate passwords based on user secrets and the application names. That way, users will be able to generate individual and hard to reverse engineer passwords for each application while having access to those passwords on pretty much any device, online or offline, as long as the algorithm is installed.
Note on AI usage: ChatGPT has been used to create the Logo, but everything else (including the name) is my own work!

title: Website and Android App for School After class
description:
Project Name
TechnikTeam - Event & Crew Management System

Elevator Pitch
I replaced my school A/V club's chaotic spreadsheets and group chats with a full-stack web app that manages everything: event scheduling, crew assignments, and a QR-code-powered gear inventory.

Detailed Description
Our school's event tech crew was a mess. To fix it, I built TechnikTeam, a custom web platform that acts as the single source of truth for all our operations. It's a full-stack Java application designed to bring order and professionalism to our student-run events.

üöÄ Core Features:

Event Scheduling & Crewing: Plan events, define roles (like "sound tech"), and assign crew members based on their skills.
Live Event Dashboard: During a show, assigned members get a real-time dashboard with a group chat and a shared task list to stay in sync.
QR-Powered Inventory: Catalog all our gear. Anyone can scan a QR code on a piece of equipment to see what it is and where it belongs, and crew members can check items in or out.
Interactive Skills Matrix: A huge grid that visually tracks which crew members are trained on which equipment, making it easy to find the right person for the job.
Role-Based Access: A full admin panel for leaders and a streamlined view for student crew members.
Tech Stack
Java (Servlets/JSP), MySQL, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Apache Tomcat.

What I Learned
Full-Stack Development: I built the entire system myself, from designing the relational database schema in MySQL to coding the backend logic in Java and building the dynamic frontend with JSP and JavaScript.
Solving a Real Problem: This wasn't a tutorial. I had to talk to my crew, understand their pain points, and design features that actually made their lives easier.
Complex Systems Design: I learned how to architect interconnected features, like making the inventory reservations appear on the event pages and building the complex data queries needed for the interactive skills matrix.

title: Vulcan League AI Engine

Runs on local machine without special configuration steps.
Cons:

Still in testing.
Contains potential unresolved bugs
Please help us report any bugs by emailing at varshneyrishit5@gmail.com or rgusmingde@gmail.com.

Thanks for your understanding!

To run program, install Python3 and make sure it working. Then, extract zip file (save it somewhere appropriate) and run main.py. You can create a virtual environment in the current working directory if necessary.

A Docker image of VLAE will be available soon for use.

title: Handheld Computer Algebra Solver
description:
There were two things that I wanted to learn throughout the summer: how computers do math and how to work with microcontrollers at the register level. My thoughts were to make a library for computer algebra in C, with the challenge of no standard library, and stick it onto a PCB with some buttons. How hard can it be?
First, I'm planning on making a library that I can ideally stick a math equation into, then it pops out a solution.
Next, I'll make the hardware for my handheld creation.
Finally, I'll write some embedded software to bridge the physical input with my library.
We'll see where this goes!

title: Timer Bot
description:
Welcome! My project features a bot for Discord communities to create detailed timers, alarms, and reminders in their Discord server. This project is very special to me because it was actually my very first coding project back in 2020! A project so small also happened to be the project that helped me discover my true passion for coding, and helped me start my journey with Node.js development. For years now, Discord has lacked a native way to create timers, alarms, and reminders in Discord servers (a rather simple feature that many large communities have asked for). This bot is my attempt to finally solve that problem once and for all!
I started developing this bot back in middle school, but over time, it became too overwhelming with the constant changes to Discord's API. With factors outside of my reach like rising server costs and busy study nights throughout the week, I eventually decided to shut down the project. Well, my goal this week is to try and bring it back to life, and rebuild the entire thing from the ground up!
I'll be honest, being my first ever coding project, Timer Bot was definitely the sloppiest code I've ever written (nowhere near being production-ready). So I figured why not spend this Summer rewriting the entire thing from scratch. I recently picked up some new equipment to help keep my personal projects running (like websites and Immich servers), so this is my attempt of reviving it and giving it another life :)
Features: - (‚è±Ô∏è) Create precise timer countdowns with hours, minutes, and seconds. - (‚è∞) Schedule alerts for specific dates and times in your local time zone. - (üìù) Add titles and descriptions to your alarms to be notified of your upcoming events, goals, and more! - (üíæ) Save timer configurations with custom names for quick access anytime. - (üìã) Manage all your running timers, alarms, and reminders in one place. - (üåê) Set your local time zone for accurate alarm scheduling. - (üîî) Choose users or roles to notify when an event ends.

title: Volume
description:
WAV files are a common file format for representing audio. WAV files store audio as a sequence of ‚Äúsamples‚Äù: numbers that represent the value of some audio signal at a particular point in time. WAV files begin with a 44-byte ‚Äúheader‚Äù that contains information about the file itself, including the size of the file, the number of samples per second, and the size of each sample. After the header, the WAV file contains a sequence of samples, each a single 2-byte (16-bit) integer representing the audio signal at a particular point in time.

Scaling each sample value by a given factor has the effect of changing the volume of the audio. Multiplying each sample value by 2.0, for example, will have the effect of doubling the volume of the origin audio. Multiplying each sample by 0.5, meanwhile, will have the effect of cutting the volume in half.

In a file called volume.c in a folder called volume, write a program to modify the volume of an audio file.


This project is a problem set from Week 4 of CS50x 2025.

title: CampusConnect
description:
CampusConnect - Building Meaningful College Connections

The Challenge:
In today's school and college environment, many students struggle to form genuine connections. Between packed class schedules and the pressure to perform academically, opportunities to meet like-minded peers are often limited. Traditional social platforms aren't designed to facilitate the kinds of friendships that make school and college rewarding.

My Solution:
CampusConnect is a specialized platform designed exclusively for college students to discover meaningful friendships. By focusing on shared academic interests, extracurricular activities and personal values, we help students cut through the noise of generic social networks.

Impact and Vision:
CampusConnect represents a new approach to student socialization - one that values quality connections over quantity. By focusing on the unique aspects of college and school life and the natural connections that exist within academic communities, we're helping students build the kinds of relationships that define the school and college experience.

title: Smartschool MCP
description:
Smartschool MCP is a custom-built MCP (Multi Context Protocol) server that acts as a bridge between Smartschool and AI agents. It connects directly with your Smartschool account, pulls your tasks, tests, and announcements, and makes them accessible via a simple protocol that can be used by AI assistants or other clients. Whether you're building a chatbot, integrating with a voice assistant, or just want an easier way to stay on top of school work, Smartschool MCP makes it effortless to ask, "Do I have any tests this week?" and actually get an answer.

Perfect for students who want to automate their workflow and stop digging through clunky school portals.

Whether it's a cozy sofa, a sleek dining set, or a minimalist work desk, the app brings furniture shopping to life with a visually engaging and intuitive frontend. Backend integration and shopping cart functionality are coming soon!

title: Decipherinator
description:
Decipherinator is mainly a cipher braking tool for simple and/or classic ciphers.
Using frequency analasys, pattern recognition, and other cryptographical magic this tool will hopefully be able to guess the original plaintext and the recover the original key used for encryption. On top of this the tool will be able to cipher and decipher text with a specific cipher, as well as give information for each one
Decipherinator is Java based, with Gradle to handle dependancies.
--(planned) FEATURES--
-ciphers:
   simple:
    -Caesar Cipher
    -ROT13
    -Atbash Cipher
   medium:
    -Monoalphabetic Substitution Cipher
    -Vigen√®re Cipher
    -Columnar Transposition Cipher
   complex:
    -Playfair Cipher
    -Autokey Cipher
    -Hill Cipher
   advanced:
    -Enigma-like Rotor Machine Ciphers
    -One-Time Pad (if key reused)
-code breaking for each cipher
-encryption with each cipher
-a lerning section with tutorials and explanations of how each cipher works and how to crack them
-a simple GUI with swing to improve UX

Example:
Paste a Docker-Compose file, click ‚ÄúDeploy‚Äù, and your app is online.

Built-in user accounts so you can safely share the platform with teammates.
100 % open source and cloud-agnostic‚Äîrun it anywhere Docker runs.

title: ExpressBuddy
description:
**ExpressBuddy** is a first-of-its-kind mobile app that uses a cartoon-style AI avatar to help children with autism, speech delays, or social anxiety improve nonverbal communication and social-emotional skills. The app creates a safe, engaging space where students can practice eye contact, emotion recognition, conversation turn-taking, and verbal expression. Powered by speech-to-text models and an emotion-aware LLM, the avatar responds naturally with animated facial expressions and social cues.

Designed for use in elementary and middle school classrooms, **ExpressBuddy** supports special education, ESL, and social-emotional learning (SEL) goals.

It supports articles, microblogs, documents, and even custom code. Built-in tools like text-to-speech, note-taking, AI summaries, and translation help users learn more effectively.

NepLoom is not just a platform; it‚Äôs a vision to make education free, fun, and accessible to everyone.

title: VibeIQ
description:
VibeIQ is a vibrant, gamified learning app designed to transform studying from a chore into an engaging adventure. Built with high school and AP students in mind, it blends education with playful competition, making it easier to stay motivated while mastering challenging subjects.  

Imagine an app that feels more like a game than homework‚Äîwhere you earn XP for every correct answer, maintain daily streaks to unlock rewards, and compete with friends on lively leaderboards. VibeIQ offers structured courses across subjects like biology, math, and literature, each broken into bite-sized quizzes with instant feedback. Miss a question? No problem‚Äîthe app explains the solution so you learn as you go.  

Beyond academics, VibeIQ keeps things fun with customizable avatars, collectible badges, and a virtual shop where you can spend gems on power-ups or cosmetic upgrades. Whether you're prepping for exams or just reinforcing classroom lessons, VibeIQ turns study sessions into something you‚Äôll actually look forward to. It‚Äôs education, but with the excitement of your favorite mobile game.

title: command_line_RPG
description:
üñ•Ô∏è command_line_RPG: The Real-World Adventure Terminal
Genre: Command Line Interface (CLI) Simulation RPG
Platforms: PC / Terminal / GitHub
Main Themes: Real-life data, Crypto (Monero), Renewable Energy, Rocket Simulation, Astronomy
Estimated Playtime: ~100 hours

üåê What is command_line_RPG?
command_line_RPG is a reality-linked RPG that transforms your real-world knowledge, actions, and experiments into a poetic, technical journey.
Using the command line, you mine crypto, observe stars, simulate rocket engines, and build renewable energy systems ‚Äî all while progressing through a richly crafted storyline.

This is a fusion of science, engineering, and self-exploration, disguised as a retro-futuristic terminal game.

üéÆ Key Features
‚öôÔ∏è Mining Missions: Use real Monero mining data to unlock story and progress.

üî≠ Astronomy Quests: Log real observations of planets, galaxies, and lunar phases.

üöÄ Rocket Engineering Simulations: Perform CEA-based engine calculations and optimize performance.

üîã Power Generation Projects: Track your own solar, wind, or hydro energy outputs and improve their efficiency.

üßæ Reality-Based Progression: All gameplay is based on your actual logs, experiments, and learning records.

üóÇÔ∏è Mission Structure
Main Missions: Large-scale achievements or scientific goals (e.g. build your first hybrid power system).

Side Missions: Daily tasks linked to energy use, learning, or stargazing.

Titles: Earn unique poetic/technical titles like ‚ÄúHashrate Seeker‚Äù or ‚ÄúPhoton Cartographer‚Äù.

üí∞ Currency System
Game currency is Monero (XMR).

Used symbolically to reflect mining efforts; no in-game shop or artificial economy.

All progress is non-commercial, learning-focused, and privacy-respecting.

üßë‚ÄçüöÄ Player Profile
You are the protagonist. Your real-world progress shapes your storyline.
From tinkering with Raspberry Pi-powered devices to late-night star logs ‚Äî your reality becomes the plot.

üìå Why play?
To learn by doing.

To gamify everyday experiments.

To document your own technical evolution.

To turn a terminal into a storytelling device.

üìÅ A game you don‚Äôt just play ‚Äî you live it.

description:
fully responsive and professionally designed personal portfolio website that highlights my journey as a full-stack web developer. It serves as my digital identity‚Äîshowcasing my skills, projects, and achievements in a visually appealing and technically sound manner.

üöÄ Key Features:
üíª Tech Stack:

Frontend: React.js (component-based structure)

Styling: Tailwind CSS (utility-first, modern responsive design)

Scripting: JavaScript (dynamic behavior and interaction)

Responsive Design: Fully optimized for mobile, tablet, and desktop

Version Control: Git & GitHub

Deployment: Hosted on a secure domain ‚Äì prashath.me

üìÇ What It Includes:

Introduction section with animation and engaging UI

Skills section with icons and tech stack cards

Projects Gallery with live links and source code

Resume Download and About Me sections

Contact Form connected with email integration

Smooth scroll, hover animations, and dark/light theme 

üß† Design Principles:

Minimalistic, fast-loading, and user-friendly interface

Semantic HTML and accessibility-first approach

Mobile-first responsive layout using Tailwind breakpoints

üéØ Purpose:
To create a strong personal brand and showcase my technical and design capabilities in real-time. This project reflects my understanding of building modern, production-ready websites from scratch using React and Tailwind CSS, with a focus on both frontend performance and user experience.

title: CVTarget
description: This web app uses any webcam/camera module to accurately track shots and points on real life air gun targets. I have built the app for raspberry Pi 5 which makes it very easy to move outside and have a portable setup. Of course any other computer powerful enough will do the job. The idea came to me when I watched the biathlon finals a couple of weeks ago. On TV they have a camera zoomed in on the targets but I wanted to do something different. I wanted to have a fully digital representation of the targets with accurate point tracking and feedback. This was the first project I have done based on image processing and it has so far been really interesting. I am currently expanding the system to dynamically draw the boundaries for different points on the target. The setup is actually quite easy so if you have an airsoft gun and a webcam laying around, give it a try!

title: Cloud VM Monitoring
description: The objective of this project is to evaluate a virtual machine's (VM) ability to support specific workloads by generating controlled traffic that allows its performance to be measured in real time. Load and performance tests will be performed using tools such as Locust, and the infrastructure will be deployed on Kubernetes, leveraging cloud services such as Cloud SQL and Cloud Run to ensure scalability and availability.

With this in mind, I created Recollekt- an app where you can create photo albums and share them with friends and family. Recollekt is user friendly and allows anyone you share the album with to add images so that you don't have to go dming every person. title: wbsrv
description:
wbsrv, a small and fast web server written in C++. I started this project to better understand how HTTP works, practice multithreading, and improve my skills in writing efficient server-side code.  It provides a simple foundation for handling HTTP requests and can be extended for different use cases.
Currently it's in active development, but I'm open to feedback what to improve.
As for now there is limited PHP support (using SAPI), fast caching of pages (5x faster) and C++ plugin API for developers. In near future will be released full PHP support and extended API.
Originally the project was made to participate in JASU (Junior Academy of Science of Ukraine), but now the aim is to create modern alternative

title: Achernar
description:
Achernar is a modular, AI-powered astronomy platform designed for real-time imaging, smart guidance, and field reliability‚Äîrunning entirely offline if needed. At its core is the Achernar Daemon, a headless service written in Rust and C++ that runs on edge devices like Raspberry Pi, Jetson, or field laptops. This daemon handles camera interfacing (via V4L2 or ASI SDK), real-time frame capture, debayering, and hardware encoding, with integrated ONNX Runtime or TensorRT for on-device inference. It runs a local REST API (via actix-web or warp) to expose control interfaces.

The AI layer performs offline inference to suggest focus, exposure, and filter settings based on local environmental conditions, using quantized ONNX models that are confidence-based and never enforced. Imaging sessions are organized in a local-first folder structure, saving FITS files, logs, and preview videos, with append-only JSON logs and optional SQLite used for dashboard caching. When internet becomes available, sessions can be automatically synced to S3, Google Drive, or Dropbox via rclone or custom Rust logic.

Users interact through either a WebApp PWA, designed with React or SvelteKit + Tailwind CSS, or a Desktop App for advanced control. The WebApp is served from the edge device over a local Wi-Fi hotspot, enabling users to preview live streams (MJPEG or WebRTC), pick targets, and start imaging directly from their phone or tablet. The Desktop App‚Äîbuilt using Qt or Tauri‚Äîcaters to professionals with tools for FITS inspection, focus metric plotting, and full mount control (via INDI or ASCOM). All user sessions are secure, crash-safe, and never rely on cloud services for imaging, making Achernar robust for remote or off-grid astronomy. Cloud sync and remote dashboards activate only post-session, ensuring reliability with WebSockets for control and WebRTC tunnels for live previews, hosted optionally via Next.js or SvelteKit on platforms like Vercel.

title: A-Maze: Create, Play and Share mazes!
description:
A-Maze is a maze game where you can generate, play and share mazes online for free. It is built using HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript. The game allows you to create mazes of different sizes and difficulty levels, and you can also play mazes created by other users. The game features a simple and intuitive interface, making it easy to navigate and play.

There are three difficulty levels: Easy, Medium, and Hard. The game also includes a timer to track your progress. Upon completing a maze, you will receive a score based on how difficult the maze is and how accurate your moves are. The score does not depend on the time taken though.

A maze collection is integrated into the game. So, you can choose any maze of your choice to play. You can also choose to generate a random maze locally on your machine instead. You can share either of these mazes with your friends by clicking "Share Maze" on the game play screen.

If you can't solve a maze, you can click "Reveal Answer" and view the solution.

AI used for code completion (GitHub Copilot)
More features like custom maze crafting will be added soon!

title: Student Form and Result Calculator (Flask App)
description:
This is a web-based application built using the Flask framework that allows users to submit student information through a dynamic form and automatically calculate results based on the provided marks or criteria. The project demonstrates core concepts of form handling, data validation, and server-side rendering using Jinja2 templates.

Key Features:

Interactive student registration form using WTForms

Backend logic to calculate grades/results

Conditional rendering of output on a success page

Organized MVC structure using Flask

Clean and modular code with Python and HTML/Jinja2

Easily extendable for use with databases (e.g., SQLite/MySQL) in future

Tech Stack:

Backend: Python (Flask)

Frontend: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap (optional)

Templating: Jinja2

Tools: Git, VS Code, Postman (for API testing if applicable)

Use Case:

Academic institutions for small-scale student management

A base project for learners to understand Flask's full request-response cycle

title: MD 2 HTML
description:
A JS script to automatically fetch your GitHub project README and convert it into HTML. I made this in hopes to contribute to summer of making, since they are also planning to build this thing.

A special feature of this is the URL parsing. The script is equipped with an automatic URL editor that converts all of your relative URLS into absolute ones.

Basically, if you want to make a portfolio website, all you have to do for each project page is to input your raw README URL and....that was actually it. Your Completely empty HTML page will become an exact replica of your README.

Of course you can always choose where it places the README so that your navbar and footer or other elements remain safe, and you can also apply custom CSS or any other styles.

title: Drift Agro 4.0
description:
My project is a modular MLOps pipeline built in Python to detect data drift in production environments. It runs automatically (e.g., daily via Airflow), compares live data against a reference dataset using tools like evidently and alibi-detect, and generates both human-readable reports and machine-readable metrics.

What makes it special is its full automation and traceability: it not only detects drift but also logs key metrics, triggers alerts via Slack or email, and can even launch retraining pipelines. Each run produces decision artifacts‚ÄîJSON outputs, HTML reports, and CSV logs‚Äîmaking the system both auditable and actionable.

title: RealTime
description:
We all have that friend with whom we spend our evenings chatting.
We all know what it feels like to stare at the words "is typing" under the name of the person we're talking to.
Have you ever thought "I wonder what he's typing" or "what a waste of time, if we were meeting in person or talking on the phone, everything would be faster"?
The goal of RealTime is exactly this: see what is being written character by character: you can almost double thespeed of communication! We are developing RT server, protocol and android client.

RT android app wants to go beyond this and make you feel in front
of your interlocutor. Thanks to its human-centered design, animations and its "organic interface". RealTime doesn‚Äôt aim to replace existing and widely
used messaging systems but rather to be an extension to them.

Features:
1. Real-time typing
2. Live voice messages
3. Live images
4. Physical proximity for contact
5. E2E encryption
6. Export JSON and nice PDF
7. Open source and well documented

title: Fast File Explorer in Rust
description: Fast File Explorer is a cross-platform file explorer built with Rust and Tauri, designed for high performance and efficient file search. It supports all major Linux distributions, macOS, and Windows, offering native installers for each platform. The application features a fast search engine capable of handling large datasets, as demonstrated by benchmarks showing search times of around 2ms for 170,000 paths‚Äîsignificantly outperforming traditional solutions like Windows Explorer. Fast File Explorer also includes real-time file watching, a caching service, and a modern user interface. The project is open source under the GPLv3 license and welcomes community contributions.

It‚Äôs made using Next.js (App Router) + React + shadcnui + TailwindCSS, with Firebase for data and Cloudinary for media uploads. The viewer site is public and read-only, while the dashboard is protected and made just for me.

title: Movie Rating System
description:
The movie rating system is a software application designed to allow users to view, rate, and review movies. Users can register and log in to access features such as submitting ratings (typically on a scale, e.g., 1 to 5 stars) and writing text reviews for movies they have watched. The system stores user ratings and calculates an average rating for each movie, which is displayed alongside the movie‚Äôs details.

Administrators can manage movie data, including adding, updating, or deleting movie entries. The system ensures that each user can rate a movie only once, but they can update their rating if needed. It may also include search and filter options to help users find movies by genre, release year, or rating. The main goal is to provide an organized way for users to share feedback and for others to discover well-rated content.

title: Unit Converter (Length)
description: This is a beginner-friendly Java console application that performs basic length unit conversions. Users can convert values between meters, kilometers, feet, and inches. The program presents a simple text-based menu for selecting the conversion type. After the user inputs their choice and a numeric value, the app calculates and shows the result. Conversions are precise and displayed with four-decimal accuracy. The logic uses a switch-case structure and basic math. Input is handled using the Scanner class for interactive use. Formatted output ensures clarity of results. It is lightweight, fast, and easy to understand. This project is perfect as a starting utility or open-source snippet.

description: The Study Tracker App is a full-stack web application built using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB. It is designed to help students organize their daily study schedule, stay motivated, and monitor their academic progress in a structured way. Users can add study tasks by subject, set estimated study durations, and mark tasks as completed. The app visually displays progress through interactive charts, making it easy to track the time spent on different subjects over days or weeks. An optional Pomodoro timer is also included to encourage focused study sessions. All user data is securely stored in MongoDB, allowing for persistent tracking across sessions. This project is ideal for students preparing for exams, learners building daily study habits, and anyone looking to improve their time management and productivity.

title: ESP32 WireGuard mesh networking project
description:
A ESP32-based networking project that uses a low-cost microcontroller to create a VPN mesh network.
We can implement a standalone WireGuard VPN server using the ESP32, allowing global internet sharing using DuckDNS integration.

Personally, in my locale, I feel I don't need to recharge my cellular and home Wi-Fi at the same time,
so I can instead use this project.

Its key innovations include:
‚Ä¢ Autonomous mesh network formation with multi-client VPN server supporting 10 device connections
‚Ä¢ Good for battery-optimised performance
‚Ä¢ Management dashboard made with Flutter and React for web and smartphone support
‚Ä¢ It eliminates the traditional limitation of ESP32 VPN implementation by combining WireGuard and ESP32 mesh protocol ‚Äî hence we can achieve a 15+ Mbps internet connection throughput using it, while having low power consumption

Applications:
‚Ä¢ Personal internet sharing
‚Ä¢ Enterprise remote access
‚Ä¢ Emergency communication
‚Ä¢ IoT fleet management

title: BiasLens - Reveal Hidden Bias
description:
BiasLens will be an open-source tool that analyzes bias in language, from stereotypes to harmful social narratives. It will extract data from articles, posts, and everyday comments.

üß† What's is in my mind?
1. I want a tool that could automatically scrapes text from the web (Twitter, Reddit, news, etc.)

2. Use NLP to detect bias using AI and custom logic

3. Understands stance, tone, and intent. The tool should be able to analyze sentiment and opinion on the topic/ bias.

4. Outputs clean, structured data for research and advocacy

5. Grading or classification system.

üéØ My Focused Areas:

Although intended to be extendable and used in various fields and topics. I first want to use it one Gender stereotype/ bias since I myself suffered from it.

üì¶ Built for:

Researchers & students

Activists & journalists

Developers exploring social impact

A Simulated Activity Tracker with delayed auto-typing to mimic focused work sessions.

Originally named Health4Hack, the project was later renamed to Soul to better reflect its purpose ‚Äî creating a digital space for self-awareness, calm, and emotional care.

title: Multi-Region Disaster Recovery
description:
This project, which originated from my university studies, is now a complete, automated disaster recovery system for AWS.

Using Terraform, I built a multi-region infrastructure with a primary EC2 instance and a backup instance in a separate region. The system automatically detects when the primary instance fails using CloudWatch Alarms. This triggers a notification via SNS and SQS, which a Python script on my home server receives. The script then instantly starts the backup EC2 instance to take over.

To monitor the system, I also developed a web dashboard using React and Flask that shows the real-time status and metrics of both instances.

title: cityBike
description:
The CityBike project is a management system for bike rentals in a city. It allows for loading customer and bike information from files, simulating reservations for electric and mechanical bikes, and calculating the costs associated with each customer. Customers can make reservations for mechanical bikes, which have no cost, or electric bikes, which have a base cost with discounts depending on their type (YOUNG or SENIOR). The system simulates 100 reservations for each day in June 2025, randomly assigning bikes to customers. At the end, the system calculates the total cost of each customer's reservations and determines who has the highest accumulated cost.

The code is structured into several classes, such as CityBike, Cliente, Bicicleta, Estacion, and Reserva, with key methods that allow loading data from binary and CSV files, simulating reservations, and calculating the associated costs. The system also handles possible errors in input data and ensures that bikes and stations are managed correctly. Information about customers, reservations, and costs is presented clearly and concisely, and the customer with the highest cost is easily identified, providing a clear view of the system's usage and costs.

I programmed this in Spanish because it is my native language and the one I feel most comfortable with.

SkillDrill.ai is a career acceleration platform for students, especially those from Tier 2 and 3 colleges. The platform provides AI-driven tools to build professional resumes, generate personalized cover letters, and create deployable portfolio websites. It also features an AI-powered interview simulator to help students prepare for technical interviews.
The project is being built using Flask (Python) for the backend, SQL for data storage, and Tailwind/React for the frontend UI. Future phases will introduce a skill-based freelancing job matching engine to help students get paid projects to build real-world proof of work.
My goal is to help students overcome the barrier of poor opportunities by giving them a toolkit of AI-powered proof-of-work generators for career growth.

title: BKFZ SubGHz
description:
Welcome! My project is called BKFZ SubGHz (stands for Brian's Knockoff Flipper Zero, lol), a custom-built ESP32 device that can scan, record, and replay SubGHz radio signals, kind of like a DIY version of the Flipper Zero!
I built this last October after getting curious about how the Flipper Zero works, and wanted to recreate part of its functionality using cheap AliExpress parts. What started as a small side project I worked on when I was free quickly turned into one of the most challenging projects I‚Äôve ever made.
The project is powered by an ESP32 (a Wi-Fi microcontroller that runs all the code) which serves a web interface you can access from your phone. The microcontroller is connected to a CC1101 transceiver, which is a chip capable of capturing and replaying SubGHz frequencies like 433‚ÄØMHz (the Flipper Zero uses this exact same chip from Texas Instruments).
The entire thing is held together by a custom PCB designed in KiCad to keep it small, and it has added support for .sub files from real Flipper Zeros (so it‚Äôs compatible with public files from the flipper community). I also added support for preset modulation to match the Flipper Zero's configuration!
Features: - Frequency Analyzer: Scan and analyze nearby devices and their frequencies with ease. - Record RAW: Capture and record nearby signals with precise RSSI configuration. - Replay RAW: Replay previously captured signals from a file (no SD card required). - Preset Configuration: Configure the frequency of your device, and set the preset modulation (just like the Flipper Zero!). - Flipper Zero Support: Effortlessly replay any Flipper Zero SUB file, including the many publicly available ones, whenever you need.

The following parts were used for the project (~$18.01 total, but you can make a minimal USB-powered one for ~$4.98)

title: üîã WattUp ‚Äì A Better Way to Track Your Battery
description:
Let‚Äôs be honest‚Äîthe default battery stats in Windows are pretty useless. You get a percentage and maybe a rough time estimate if you're lucky. That‚Äôs where WattUp comes in.

WattUp is a simple but powerful app that gives you actual insight into your laptop's battery. Whether you‚Äôre trying to figure out why your battery drains so fast or just want better info while charging, WattUp has your back.
Here‚Äôs what it can do:

    Track battery usage over time with clean, interactive graphs

    Show your battery health, including wear level and original vs current capacity

    Give you charging and discharging estimates based on real usage, not guesswork

    Show detailed battery stats like cycle count, voltage, temperature, and more

    Run quietly in the background without eating up your system resources

It‚Äôs everything the Windows battery meter should‚Äôve been, but isn‚Äôt.

If you care about your battery and want better control over how your device uses power, WattUp makes it easy.

EDULates is an AI-powered web platform designed to enhance and personalize the process of learning new languages. Built with Django and integrated with open-source language models, EDULates offers an intelligent, interactive, and user-friendly environment where students can improve their grammar, vocabulary, translation skills, and conversational fluency.

Leveraging powerful open-source NLP models (such as T5, Gramformer, and Helsinki-NLP), EDULates enables learners to:

üìù Receive real-time grammar and spelling corrections with explanations

üåç Translate sentences intelligently between languages with contextual understanding

üí¨ Engage in realistic conversations with an AI-powered language partner

üéØ Practice through customized exercises and receive adaptive feedback based on performance

Whether you're a beginner or an advanced learner, EDULates adapts to your level and learning style, providing instant guidance and personalized suggestions. It is designed to make language learning more dynamic, effective, and accessible ‚Äî all powered by free and open-source AI models.

title: SHG Management
description:
# SHG Management System

A comprehensive Self-Help Group (SHG) management system built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Prisma.

## Features

- **Group Management**: Create, manage, and oversee multiple self-help groups
- **Member Management**: Track member information, contributions, and loans
- **Financial Tracking**: Monitor group finances, loans, and repayments
- **PDF Import**: Import member data from PDF documents
- **Role-based Access**: Support for admins, group leaders, and members
- **Secure Authentication**: JWT-based authentication with role management
- **Responsive Design**: Works seamlessly on desktop and mobile devices

## Tech Stack

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- **Backend**: Next.js API Routes, Prisma ORM
- **Database**: MongoDB (via Prisma)
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js
- **File Processing**: PDF-parse, PDFJS-dist
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with dark mode support

title: Rust QOI implementation with Python bindings
description:
The "Quite OK Image Format" (https://qoiformat.org/) is a lossless image compression format that compresses images to a similar size of PNG, while offering 20x-50x faster encoding and 3x-4x speedier decoding.

I heard about it in a video talking about how PNGs work (https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=EFUYNoFRHQI) and found it interesting and it's specification fits on one A4 page, so I decided to implement my version of it in Rust (learning Rust the process) and creating Python bindings for it as python is my primary programming language. This will be a challenge, but I am down for it (-:

description:
DITMail is a next-generation mail server platform built for modern developers, startups, and enterprises who need full control over sending and receiving email‚Äîwhether for personal inboxes, businesses, or temporary email use cases.

Powered by Haraka, enhanced with DKIM/TLS security, and designed for Dockerized scalability, DITMail offers a flexible email ecosystem that supports:

üåê Custom domain hosting

üîê End-to-end authenticated SMTP

üì• Catch-all or per-user inbox routing

üß© Modular plugin system for anti-spam, DKIM, queueing, and user validation

‚öôÔ∏è Built-in DKIM key generator and TLS provisioning

üöÄ Webmail-ready architecture with IMAP extensibility (via Dovecot)

üß™ Developer-friendly APIs and logs for integration and testing

DITMail supports both temporary email applications (like public inboxes or disposable addresses) and professional-grade email services (with authentication, Maildir inboxing, and domain-based identity).

Whether you're building:

A temp mail site like freecustom.email

A Zoho Mail-like pro SaaS for clients with custom domains

Or your own personal mail server with full transparency and control

‚Ä¶DITMail is your all-in-one, open, and modular email infrastructure toolkit.

title: Vidminal
description:
üì∫ Vidminal: Terminal Video as ASCII Art

--- WHAT IS THIS THING, ANYWAY?! ---
ü§î ‚ñ∫ Ever wished you could watch videos... in your terminal? ü§Ø
ü§® ‚ñ∫ NO? Well, I DON'T CARE, HERE IT IS. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
üëÄ ‚ñ∫ You've seen ASCII art demos. You've seen those looping gifs. Cute. üòè This ain't that.
‚ú® ‚ñ∫ Vidminal takes [ANY] video file you throw at it‚Äîyour favorite anime clip üé¨, a movie üçø, that weird cat video from 2009 üòº‚Äîand turns it into a live, colorful, animated ASCII art spectacle right in your terminal.
üé∂ ‚ñ∫ And it's not just a silent movie. We've got synchronized audio. üîä We've got full controls. üéÆ This isn't a toy; it's a legit, if slightly unhinged, [TERMINAL MEDIA PLAYER]. üöÄ

---

--- HOW'D I MAKE IT HAPPEN? ---
üêç ‚ñ∫ It's a Python party! üéâ
üí™ ‚ñ∫ I wrangled some of Python's coolest libraries to pull this off:
üé¨ ‚ñ∫ `moviepy` & `ffmpeg`: To rip the video and audio apart. ‚úÇÔ∏è
üñºÔ∏è ‚ñ∫ `Pillow`: For the pixel-to-text magic. ‚úçÔ∏è
üîà ‚ñ∫ `pygame`: To blast the sound waves at your ears. üéß
üé® ‚ñ∫ `colorama`: To paint everything in glorious 24-bit color. üåà
‚ö° ‚ñ∫ `threading`: To make sure the controls work while the video is playing, because nobody likes a laggy player.
üó∫Ô∏è ‚ñ∫ It was a journey fueled by caffeine ‚òï and a questionable sense of purpose. üåÄ

---

--- WHY IS IT AWESOME? ---
üåü ‚ñ∫ It's pure, unfiltered, terminal power! ‚ú®
üïπÔ∏è ‚ñ∫ TOTAL CONTROL: You get a full-fledged player experience. Pause, play, quit, rewind, and fast-forward. Adjust the volume. Mute the chaos. It's all there. ‚èØÔ∏èüéöÔ∏è
üì¶ ‚ñ∫ ZERO SETUP: Download the release for your OS and just... run it. üöÄ I bundled `ffmpeg` so you don't have to install a single thing. I did the boring work for you. You're welcome. üôè
‚úÖ ‚ñ∫ THE BEST PART: YOU ARE THE ARTIST! üé® Don't like the default look? Open `options.json` and:
‚úçÔ∏è ‚ñ∫ [CHANGE THE CHARACTERS!] Use `‚ñà‚ñì‚ñí‚ñë` for a blocky look, or a detailed set like `$@B%8&...`, or even make your own `custom` set! You control the texture of your video! Â≠óÁ¨¶‚ú®
üéõÔ∏è ‚ñ∫ [TWEAK THE VISUALS!] Adjust `gamma` and `contrast` to get that perfect moody, cyberpunk, or over-saturated look. ‚öôÔ∏èüìä
ü§Ø ‚ñ∫ Prepare for your friends to look over your shoulder and go, "WTF?! Is that... a movie... in your terminal?" üò≤
üëç ‚ñ∫ Yes. Yes it is. üòé

title: Modular MIDI Controll Change Input device
description:
I am building a modular midi input device for music production, dj stuff and light software control. 

The device will function like this:
There is a Main Module with an ESP32 and some useful input devices like sliders, rotary encoders and buttons.
The main module connects through either serial USB (the usb-c port on the ESP) or through wifi (udp data stream) to the driver pc where the DAW, Virtual DJ, lighting control or any other software that supports midi runs on.
On the sides of this module there should be spring loaded pins and magnets. You can connect other modules to the main module using these pins that are on every module. 
The modules work through a msp430 (or equivalent). This chip has a unique ID and sends/receives data through all the other modules that are between it and the main module

This project is only for the PC Driver Software and I will probably add the hardware stuff to the repo and project later.
The PC Software will be available on Linux (on which it is developed), Windows and MacOS.
It will also be useful for everyone who wants to have a easy software to use a DIY ESP-32 based MIDI input device. I will provide documentation and a Tutorial on how to do this.

To be transparent: I use AI to generate Styles for the UI, to generate documentation texts (i am not good at writing stuff) and to understand error messages better, but the code is written by me, and the hardware is designed by me.

title: FIXAPL
description: FIXAPL is a programming language inspired by APL, re-imagined using fixed-arity functions all the way down. Fixed-arity means that contrary to other APL dialects, there are no variadic functions. That seems like it would be a disadvantage, but it actually provides a lot of benefits, aiding readability of the language as well as providing more expressive tacit (point-free) forms of construction.

title: Okta Role Mining with OPA-Driven Access Recommendations
description:
This project automates the process of role mining in Okta by integrating a LangGraph-based agent with GPT-powered group suggestion and Open Policy Agent (OPA) for access validation. The system analyzes user profiles, their current group memberships, and department data to intelligently recommend group assignments. It validates these recommendations against organizational policies enforced by OPA, ensuring compliant and optimized group assignments.

The solution includes:
1. A React-based Frontend for user selection and result visualization.
2. A FastAPI-based Backend to handle agent requests and serve the LangGraph engine.
3. An Okta API Integration Layer for real-time user and group data retrieval.
4. An OPA Policy Evaluation Layer to block non-compliant group assignments.
5. Real-time logs for step-by-step traceability.
This project streamlines identity governance, enhances security posture, and provides an interactive interface for role analysis and decision-making.

Wrapper Layer: Orchestrating the System
The Wrapper Layer acts as the central orchestration engine that connects the frontend, backend, LangGraph agent, Okta APIs, and the OPA policy engine in a seamless flow. It provides a unified API interface that simplifies interactions across these distributed components.

Key functions of the Wrapper Layer:
1. Data Aggregation:
Collects user and group information from the Okta API and serves it in a cleaned, frontend-friendly format.
2. Process Invocation:
Sends user data to the LangGraph agent for group suggestion and orchestrates the complete flow from input selection to final decision.
3. Response Routing:
Handles asynchronous processing and real-time log streaming to the frontend, ensuring users can track every step of the decision process live.
4. Abstraction:
Decouples the complex backend logic from the React frontend, providing clean and minimal APIs for easy consumption.
5. Modular Branches:
Supports independent development and versioning of different components (agent, backend, frontend, OPA) by providing a consistent entry point.

title: Just Thanks Exchange
description:
JTExchange (aka Just Thanks Exchange, JTEx) is a cool, digital P2P conduct-points system that turns every kind act into tradeable campus credit‚Äîsend points to friends, stack points for perks, or just flex on the leaderboard.

GPT says "A lot of U.S. schools use PBIS‚Äîpoint-based rewards for positive behavior (aka conduct points)"
‚Äîso we‚Äôve simply taken that idea online and turned it into a peer-to-peer system.
Imagine when Rankings, XPs, Levels, and rewards appear in this points system. It‚Äôs not teachers scoring you, it‚Äôs friends recognizing you.

Features:
- Natural-language trading (thanks to LLMs)
- LLM-powered history summaries
- Campus posts (even with voting)

Tech Stack:
- Frontend: Vue 3 + Ant Design
- Backend: JavaScript + Express
- DB Compatibility: support Vercel SQL, DetaBase, or any sequelize.js supported database (including PostgreSQL)
- Deployment: My homeserver + Cloudflare

Notice:
- There are some things that have not been i8n yet
- Demo Links cannot reflect the latest program (a more stable version will be deployed)

title: MindPilot
description:
MindPilot is an AI-powered productivity and learning assistant designed to help users stay focused and understand any topic more effectively.
As a technical high school student preparing for final exams, I often face two major problems: it's hard to stay concentrated for long periods, and it's even harder to understand difficult topics quickly and deeply. MindPilot was born from this personal frustration, a tool that combines a smart focus assistant with an intelligent tutor, all in a lightweight and accessible web app.

MindPilot allows you to start distraction-free focus sessions using a timer-based system while keeping track of your progress. But what makes it unique is the ability to ask any question or type any topic, and the built-in AI (powered by Cohere‚Äôs Command R+ model) explains it in a clear and understandable way. Whether you're struggling with a math concept, a programming topic, or even a piece of history, MindPilot is here to help.

The project is built using React for the frontend and FastAPI for the backend. It connects to the Cohere API to generate explanations in real time. A .env system is used to keep API keys safe, and the frontend and backend communicate through REST endpoints.

Throughout the Summer of Making, I plan to extend MindPilot with new features such as:

A personal progress dashboard
Support for multiple subjects and languages
Enhanced session analytics
And eventually, a mobile app version
The goal is to turn MindPilot into something that doesn't just help me but could help any student, self-learner, or curious mind around the world. It‚Äôs more than a study tool. It‚Äôs a digital co-pilot for your brain.

title: [WH] Working Healthily Â∑•‰ΩçÂ§©‰Ωø
description:
It's a pretty cool system that uses CV (specifically YOLO) and LLMs to keep an eye on desk jockey health in the office. It's like a real-world "screen time tracker"!

It basically monitors your posture, how much you're moving around, and even your water intake. The idea is to give you real-time health feedback and suggestions right when you need them.

Backend: Vue+FastAPI+SQLite, nothing special
Hardware: we're rocking ESP-LCD-EV and ESP-CAM boards, using PlatformIO with Arduino and FreeRTOS

One awesome feature is that a single host PC can connect to multiple lower-level devices simultaneously. So, you could have a whole bunch of workstations monitored at once.

Now it is mainly developed for Chinese (Simplified), maybe in the future we will consider i18n üåê

This project is a bit extensive. My mentor created the first version, but now it is almost entirely mine.

title: Local SysPilot
description:
üìÑ Project Description (English)


Local SysPilot is a cross-platform, local-network-based system control dashboard.

Its core goal is to allow users to remotely manage their own computers (Linux or Windows) within a local network or VPN‚Äînot through the public internet.

Through a secure web interface, you can perform actions like shutting down, locking, or controlling media playback on your device from another trusted device on the same network.

The backend is built for each platform:

    üêß On Linux, it uses Python and FastAPI for easy scripting and control.

    ü™ü On Windows, it uses C++ with the Windows API to maximize control and understanding of system internals.

üîß Core Features

    Secure login with a lightweight web-based control panel

    System actions: shutdown, lock, sleep, media control

    Cross-platform: Linux and Windows

    Runs locally or over VPN, not exposed to the public web

    Modular backend for easy extension (e.g., custom commands)

    (Optional) Future support for viewing basic system metrics (CPU/RAM, uptime)

    ‚ö†Ô∏è System monitoring features are not part of the core idea and may or may not be implemented.

üìÑ Descripci√≥n del Proyecto (Espa√±ol)

Local SysPilot es un panel de control multiplataforma para administrar tu propio sistema desde una red local o una VPN.

El objetivo principal del proyecto es permitir a los usuarios ejecutar acciones de control del sistema (como apagar, bloquear o controlar el audio/multimedia) desde otro dispositivo de confianza, sin depender de la nube ni exponer nada a Internet.

La interfaz es web, segura y ligera, y se conecta a un backend que var√≠a seg√∫n el sistema operativo:

    üêß En Linux, se usa Python y FastAPI para facilitar la integraci√≥n y control.

    ü™ü En Windows, se usa C++ con la API de Windows para tener control real y aprendizaje profundo del sistema.

üîß Funcionalidades principales

    Login seguro con panel de control v√≠a navegador

    Acciones del sistema: apagar, bloquear, suspender, controlar multimedia

    Soporte para Linux y Windows

    Solo accesible en red local o VPN (nunca desde Internet p√∫blica)

    Backend modular para agregar comandos personalizados f√°cilmente

    (Opcional) Soporte futuro para ver m√©tricas b√°sicas del sistema (CPU, RAM, uptime)

    ‚ö†Ô∏è Las funciones de monitorizaci√≥n del sistema no forman parte del objetivo principal y podr√≠an no implementarse.

title: PrimeVector - new fast algorithm for GCD and LCM
description:
I‚Äôm building a high-performance arithmetic system in Rust that rethinks number representation. By encoding integers as prime exponent vectors, it converts:
Multiplication ‚Üí Vector addition
GCD/LCM ‚Üí Min/Max operations
Matrix math ‚Üí Optimized vector transforms
The core innovation exploits prime factorization‚Äôs mathematical properties. Modern hardware outperforms this approach for general cases of multiplication due to extreme optimization of traditional arithmetic. The key bottleneck is factorization latency (why RSA works). Today, it‚Äôs not viable for multiplication, but one can easily figure out the most efficient cases for it and combine the binary GCD algorithm with the PFS (Prime Factor System) algorithm and then we get an optimized version of the binary GCD and LCM algorithms (the second one is heavily based on GCD).
Future quantum integration could revolutionize multiplication too:
Shor‚Äôs algorithm would enable efficient factorization
Practical for huge numbers (n > 2^25 bits based on my calculations)
Turns prime vectors into an universal accelerator for many operations
